thread.title: FileMaker special offer: Buy one, give one! You and a colle
thread.title_full: FileMaker special offer: Buy one, give one! You and a colle

author: FileMaker, Inc.
title: FileMaker special offer: Buy one, give one! You and a colle
text:
SANTA CLARA, Calif. , Oct. 14, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- FileMaker, Inc. today announced a Buy One, Get One Free promotion for FileMaker Pro 14 and FileMaker Pro 14 Advanced. This worldwide limited-time offer allows those who purchase either product to receive a second downloadable copy of the same product for free (valued at US$329 or US$549 , respectively) from FileMaker. Now, those who purchase FileMaker software through December 18, 2015 can provide a copy of FileMaker Pro 14 or FileMaker Pro 14 Advanced to new staff members and teams – or even as a gift to a favorite charity. The special offer helps individuals and teams create solutions – rapidly and affordably to easily create custom apps that run seamlessly across for iPad, iPhone, Windows, Mac and the web. 
"This limited promo is a great opportunity for users to share the power and simplicity of the FileMaker platform with other team members," said Brad Freitag , vice president, Americas Sales and Asia Pacific for FileMaker. 
The offer applies only to FileMaker Pro 14 or FileMaker Pro 14 Advanced and is limited to one gift request per person, household or company between October 12, 2015 and December. 18, 2015 ( Oct. 14 and Dec. 18 in Japan ). The promotion is valid only for the downloadable versions of the products purchased from the FileMaker Store . The free versions are fully working, not-for-resale versions of FileMaker Pro 14 or FileMaker Pro 14 Advanced for Windows and Mac. The offer is not valid in connection with any other rebates, discounts or promotions. Click here for full offer details and other restrictions.
About FileMaker, Inc.
FileMaker, Inc., an Apple subsidiary, delivers simply powerful software for easily creating custom apps that work seamlessly across iPad, iPhone, Windows, Mac, and the web. Business teams use the FileMaker Platform to streamline their operational processes, boosting overall productivity.
